dialogues.text: et CAMERA BOOMS UP, leaving them, and PANS ACROSS the second floor windows. Light shines from one of them, and in 4t we can see Professor Hobbs, speaking to someone on the telephone, the broken piece of gold- Plated copper in her hand. La aoe : ’ CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ABANDONED FARM - NIGHT — ; : 159 The Professor's car travels slowly over a rutted path, then stops near a ramshackle barn. The doors open and the three of them step out into the night. Mary points toward the large opening in the front of the barn that once had doors. They begin toward it. ;

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE NOTE
dialogues.text: The following scenes, ending on page 61 (Scene 199), will take place in and around an AUTO WRECKING YARD within the city, as opposed to a rural farm and abandoned barn. Dialogue will remain the same. Action will be changed as necessary to suit the new location, but will remain as much as possible as is.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP SHOT 160
dialogues.text: With Mary slightly in the lead, the three of them approach the dark entrance. Joey glances nervously over his shoulder, always wary. Mary is the first to reach the opening.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR MARY 7 161
dialogues.text: She stops, abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (intensely alert) What is it? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 162
dialogues.text: Joey and the Professor take the last few steps, coming up alongside Mary. They look. ANGLE - DESTRUCTION 163° Unrecognizable as a space craft -- or, for that matter, anything -- the center of the decrepit structure is a mass of twisted metal, charred metal, in the middle of a six-foot deep crater.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) That was your ship? Mary can barely accept it. She shakes her head, as if to deny the reality.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) They destroyed your ship? And then, suddenly, the realization. Joey whirls around, his eyes scanning the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: FARM YARD 165
dialogues.text: Something glints, almost imperceptibly, like shiny steel briefly reflecting a moonbeam.  e-> 166 167 168 169 55.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY _ 166
dialogues.text: He spins back around.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Get down!!! He pushes both women hard on their backs. Both of them lurch forward. Joey dives on top of them, as one side of the barn erupts in a roaring fulmination of flaming splinters. Professor Hobbs screams in terror as she starts to rise, hysterical, having no idea of what she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; shouting) Stay down! He reaches out for her, but misses by inches. Professor Hobbs screams again. And now, a second explosion. 7

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR 167
dialogues.text: Her body is hurled through the fiercely-glowing darkness by the force of the explosion. She dies instantly.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 168
dialogues.text: He whirls around to face the farm yard and the invisible, deadly enemy.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; shouting insanely) Damn you!

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR MARY 169
dialogues.text: She pulls him down beside her, her face smudged with dirt, her hair filled with ashes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Listen to me, please! They only want me. Don't you understand? They only want me! Joey is like a crazy man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Well, they're not going to get you! No way! He glances around, feverishly, looking for a place to hide. Then, remembering the crater, he grabs her, hauls her her to her feet, and yanks her after him. -

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Run! Run!

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 170
dialogues.text: They race toward the crater and leap into it just as a third explosion rocks the barn, blowing out another massive piece of wall. Chunks of flaming wood rain down around them, as they huddle beneath the lip of the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A momentary silence. He raises his head above the crater's edge and peers through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: FARM YARD 172
dialogues.text: The Professor's car remains where it was, gleaming in the moonlight thirty yards away. The two Nazis suddenly appear, dashing from one hiding place to another -- but this time closer to the barn.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) We've got to get to the car.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (angry) It isn't impossible! Nothing's impossible! We've just got to figure it out. But now still another explosion. Joey and Mary duck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's like the entire world 1s blowing up around then, piece by piece. Then, when the noise subsides, Joey leaps up again. ieee

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; shouting) Where'd you guys learn to shoot? In the R.O.T.C.? He drops back down, feeling better. Then, the inspiration. He spins around to face her.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) You've got to do it. She doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) No games now. No parlor tricks. I want you to move the car. She stares at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: You can! I know you can!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Even if I could, they'll destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Those guys hit a moving target? She takes his hand, holds it tight.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (intense) You're not listening to me, Joey. If they wanted me dead, I'd be dead. They're giving us a chance, don't you understand? They're willing to let you live... but only if I walk out of here alone. And now he grabs Mary, and his intensity 4s even greater. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Joey Donizetti doesn't roll over and play dead! Okay? Alright? And neither will you... not so long as we're together! And then, like a grand punctuation to his speech, another section of the barn goes up in flames.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING MARY
dialogues.text: She rises, tentatively, and peers over the lip of the crater to the car. Joey watches her. Her face doesn't betray the effort, but the perspiration immediately begins to form on her face, and mixes with the soot and grime, and starts to streak. Joey looks anxiously toward the car. Nothing's happening. He turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) One more thing... (then, with almost a smile) Try for about thirty miles an hour, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The perspiration covers her entire face, her arms, her hands.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR BILLY
dialogues.text: He gives her all the support he can, silently urging her on, nodding his head, glancing back and forth between Mary and the car. Then, a horrible thought. He shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; half- whispered) Please, God, don't let her have set the brake.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELS
dialogues.text: They move, just a bit, and then just a bit more. 58. 173 174 175 176 177  eX 178 179 180 181 182 183 184 59.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 178
dialogues.text: He's seen it.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; quietly) It's moving. You're doing it. It's moving.

dialogues.speaker: MARY 179
dialogues.text: For the first time we see evidence of the strain, see it in her expression. If the Nazis don't kill her, this just might.

dialogues.speaker: NAZIS 180
dialogues.text: They're positioned well ahead of the car, can't see it unless they look back, and evidently haven't heard it begin to coast forward yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “One of them is aiming his weapon toward the fragile remains of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY AND MARY 182
dialogues.text: as another explosion tears a gaping hole in the roof, not quite over their heads. Joey ducks instinctively, but not Mary -- so intent in her effort that she may not have even noticed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embers and ashes and spinters fall onto her hair and. shoulders, but she makes no move to rid herself of them.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY AND MARY 184
dialogues.text: He rises again, sees her, sees the car -- imperceptibly picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; intense) Now, Mary! You've got to do it now!  185 @ iss 187 188 189 ern 190 191 192 60.

dialogues.speaker: MARY 185
dialogues.text: She does.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: It lurches forward in a sudden burst of motion, heading directly toward the barn, rapidly gaining momentun.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY 187
dialogues.text: staring, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: NAZIS 188
dialogues.text: Hearing the motion, they spin around. The car rushes past them, quiet as a sailboat. Momentarily shaken by this unexpected sight, they forget to act.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY AND MARY
dialogues.text: He leaps from the crater, almost explosively.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; a victorious shout) Yeah!1! He reaches down and hauls Mary out.

dialogues.speaker: NAZIS 190
dialogues.text: Both of them fire.

dialogues.speaker: CAR 191
dialogues.text: Two misses. One of the explosions carves a new crater in the earth, ten feet from the back of the moving car. The other misses entirely, even misses the barn. No longer under Mary's control, the car slows as it approaches the entrance to the barn.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 192
dialogues.text: Joey leaps for the door handle, flings open the door, shoves Mary into the car, then jumps in after her. He fires up the engine, crams it into reverse, revs the motor, pops the clutch.
196 They spin crazily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It almost rockets away, smashing through a rotten fence, and out over a rugged field. : eI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee ee eer ae They get to their feet and stare in silent rage toward the by-now distant car. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT - CAR. ge 199 Bouncing almost merrily over the field, under the moon- light, on toward freedom. CAMERA TILTS UP, way up, to include a distant helicopter, hovering at first, but now beginning to move in the same direction. Over this:

dialogues.speaker: . RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (filterea) Eagle Five to roost: subject vehicle under visual surveillance, heading north, northeast. Will advise progress. Eagle Five out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i, 199A” 1998 muvee ee 4/08 6lA*

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Hobbs' car appears from around a corner, drives toward camera, pulls to the curb and stops. Traffic continues by on the drivers side. Beyond the passenger side of the car is an outdoor skating rink, surrounded by shimmering lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and Mary sit in silence. Both are dirty, exhausted, emotionally drained. Joey turns to her. He's at a loss to know what to say, but he knows that he has to address the issue.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: I can't say I know how you feel, because I don't. But if it's 7 anything even close to what I'm feeling, then we've got to talk about it. Okay? Will you talk to me, Mary? : A pause. Then,

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Professor Hobbs is dead because of me.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: If I hadn't come here ... if I hadn't met you eee

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: {cuts her off) Wait a minute! Why don't we go back ‘a-ways. How about if I hadn't been born ... or the world didn't exist ...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Joey ...

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: No! Let's do it righti You want to toss some blame around? How the brains on your planet who built the ship that got you here. How about the people that built this car, Professor Hobbs' car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eo

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continued) Hell, if they'd designed it so it could've gone ten years without an oil change, she never would have : brought it into the shop, and I never would've thought of going to the planetarium in the first Place. : She's dead, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Yes, she's dead. But not because ef you. You didn’t ask her to go out there tonight. It was her idea, her decision. (pause; then) Look, I don't know how things work on your planet ... things like life and death. But here we don't get a choice. Death is the only sure thing we've got. Everything else ... is up for grabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1998 They stare at one another in silence, and then Joey makes a concerted effort to break the mood. He grins gently, then,.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Tell me the truth: Do I look as Burned-out as you do? A pause. She nods. He starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: _Ever take a bath? She doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives away. 199c  te 7 : REV. DEC. °17/84
200 EXT, RURAL MOTEL — NIGHT : 200 It's a joint; just about half a step better than a dive. Stewy's car pulls into the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and Mary are standing in the tiny bathroom, staring at the water pouring into the tub. She seems a bit uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I just... sit in 1t?- JOEY 7 a Well yeah, sort of. You can do : @ lot of things. You can read @ book; just kind of relax; wash up... ; c He trails off. She's getting the picture. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: | (continuing) | Okay? Yes. Okay. And without further tadoo, and in complete innocence, she pulls her sweater up and off over her head, and then immediately begins to unfasten her bra. Joey almost jumps.

dialogues.speaker: . _ JOEY
dialogues.text: No, no, wait! , hos 7 , Mary stops, staring at him quizzically. He feels | ridiculous. He might actually be blushing. He stammers.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, it's Just that... well, we don't... He's saved by Stewy's KNOCKING on the front door, and ee. then his voice: i ' (CONTINUED)  63.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ( STEWY (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joey! You in there? Joey turns back to Mary.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: That's Stewy. I better go let - him in. Mary nods. Joey nods. He backs out of the bathroom and politely closes the door -- with profound relief. He takes a beat to compese himself, then crosses to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in without speaking. He's carrying two grocery bags. He glances around the room. He sees the light i glowing from beneath the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: The she-creature in there?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Ci Mary's in there, if that's who t. you mean. She's taking a bath. e STEWY No kidding? They take baths on her planet, too? He drops: the bags on the bed, points to one of them:

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Pants, shirt, underwear, socks, shaving things.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: (pointing to the other bag) The only way I got Grace to part with that stuff was by telling her she'd be the only woman on her block loaning clothes to a Martian. Joey makes a conscious effort to ignore the cynicism. r ) . (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rev: Nov. 8/84

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Thank Grace for me.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: Don't mention it. He withdraws a plastic zippered bag and displays it. ba

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: The makeup was Grace's idea. hal Joey nods his appreciation. Stewy puts the cosmetic 7 bag aside and pulls a couple of beers from one of ‘ad the bags. He offers one to Joey. Then, eyeballing . the room again; i

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: Nice place. ial He suddenly lashes out and slaps his hand down on . Goue crawling thing.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: Getting friendly with the regulars?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: ZI only had eighteen bucks on me.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: Yeah? In a place like this, that ought to be good for a week. (sips; then) So, tell me about the goddess: she likes taking baths? Or maybe she saw that movie, you know? About the mermaid? Splash? (glances toward the bathroom door; nods to himself) Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: What she likes, I think, is trying new things.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) When in Rome...

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (xzemembering) She started taking off her clothes, right in front of me, like it didn't mean a thing. I had to tell her we don't do that here.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: Who doesn't? 64  202 en7 65.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY /
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. |

dialogues.speaker: STEWY '
dialogues.text: How far did she get? \

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Not far.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: So you didn't see anything? i

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: What d'you mean, I didn't see anything? What was I supposed to see?

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: What're you, a cabbage-head all of a sudden? The girl's supposed to be from another planet, right? Didn't it ever occur to you that something might be different? A thoughtful pause all around. Then, shaking his head:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Forget that. He sips his beer, trying to do as he preached, but it's not easy. He's got to admit, even if it's only to himself, that it's a provocative consideration. Then, lowering his voice:

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: I suppose you realize what we've got here.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: I mean, that stunt with the snow... He makes a wavy-hand gesture that he accompanies with a slightly musical sound: outer limits.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: (continuing) She had Ralph and me talking to ourselves for the rest of the day. I was putting a new muffler on this Caddy? Welded it in upside- down and backwards... swear to God. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) r Yeah, it makes you wonder, alright. : Stewy pulls his chair closer to where Joey's sitting, then lowers his voice yet another notch: true - conspirators.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: Remember all those lottery tickets we bought? All those sweeps tickets? Remember all those dreams we used to have? A pause. He grins as he reaches out and pats Joey on the knee.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, they're about to come true, my friend... every last one of them. i Joey stares at him. He still isn't catching on.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: (continuing) We've got ourselves a gold mine, Joey. No, strike that. We've got ourselves a diamond mine! (pause; then) You know what this lady could do for us in Atlantic City? You kmow what she could do for us at the track? I'm talking millions, Joey, I'm talking millions and millions. @rx A silence. Joey's finally caught on. He's so personally offended he can barely speak straight.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: What're you...? Are you saying we should...? Stewy, righteously indignant, sits back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: | Hey, this is me, Stewy. Don't go innocent on me, alright? Okay? We know each other.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No... No... I don't think we do.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: Come on, man, climb down off it. We've been friends for what... fifteen, sixteen years? Step in front of a truck for each other, right? am I right? (then, almost fiercely emphatic) I know you, Joey. So don't go getting holier-than-thou on me all of a sudden, will you, please? This is the greatest thing that's ever happened in any of our lives. What're you going to do, toss it away? A silence.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (almost calmly) There was this friend of mine, this nice lady whose car I used to work on. She said to Mary: Do you know what's going to happen when people find out about you? Do you know how nasty it could get? (a pause; then, really hurt) I never thought she was talking about you, Stewy. Another silence. Joey stands up.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) : Do me a favor, will you? Go home and think about it. Talk to Ralph. Tell him what I said. Tell him how I feel. And tell him I'm in trouble, Stewy. Me and Mary both are.

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: What d'you mean? What kind of trouble? Joey ignores the question; just continues on: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: And then tomorrow morning... if . you're with me... come on back here and the three of us will put our heads together, Just like we always have, and we'll figure a way out of it.- A pause,

dialogues.speaker: . JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) I need you guys, Stewy. I need your help. Brief, uncertain silence. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stewy exits the room, but even before he can look around, four plain clothes federal agents are literally on top of him, pinning his arms, gagging his mouth, arid hauling him away. One of the agents reaches into Stewey's jacket pocket, withdraws his car keys, and tosses them to another man. As they manhandle Stewey away from the area, with Stewey struggling helplessly, camera pans to a motel room thats on the opposite side of the parking area, directly opposite Joey and Mary's room.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ~“ 204 Rev. Nov. 9/84 69. f s INT. 2ND MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT - CLOSE SHOT rs 204 that includes a tabletop; a two-way radio; a portion of & reel-to-reel tape recorder, reels spinning; a burning ~ cigarette in a butt-filled ashtray; two styrofoam cups of coffee; and the arms and hands of two men, playing From the radio:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Eaglethree to roost. Subject 7 apprehended. Situation secure. Returning to base. Out. From the tape recorder, the SOUND of a door opening, then: ;

dialogues.speaker: JOEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How was the bath?

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Different. Still on a CLOSE SHOT, CAMERA TRACKS to follow a cord from the tape recorder's mike input, across a short distance, then to a partially open window. There, on a black-chrome stand, facing out across the parking lot to the opposite wing of the motel, is a long range audio surveillance microphone.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You look... fresh.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Is that good? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: en~ en e~ 204 205 Rev. Nov. 9/84

dialogues.speaker: JOEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. A SLOW RACK FOCUS, and now we can clearly see the exterior of the unit occupied by Joey and Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary stands in the bathroom doorway, wearing something Stewey brought for’ her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Is this alright?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Sure. Grace's things fit okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes. It was kind of them.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: We go back a long way. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 205 A silence, and then Joey shakes his head, sort of laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) : Every once in a while I kind of forget who you are. I mean, I find myself talking to you like you're just another... person. Crazy, isn't 1t?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I am just another person... in my world. Another silence. She crosses to the bed and sits. They stare at each other. She smiles gently.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (continuing) You'd like to ask me things. (CONTINUED)
205 JOEY . I guess I would, yeah. Like the big one: what's it like... where you came from?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That 1s a big question. Nevertheless, he waits for her answer. She trails

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Before I met you, before I knew the enemy had followed me here, I had two days to try to understand your world. (pause; then) Do you remember how quickly I was able to solve the problem Professor Hobbs gave me?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY -
dialogues.text: Who could forget?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It's because the people of my world are... off. He helps her to the point:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Smarter than us.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'd rather say... older than you.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: You mean you've been around longer,

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes. And we've had time to develop certain abilities. But none that humans won't also develop, in their time.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (grins) But right now we kind of seem like Planet Of The Apes, right? She doesn't understand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Forget it. Goon. .

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I had two days... to visit your libraries, your museums, watch your television.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: And in two days you were able to understand us?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (smiles) No. But I was able to learn your language, and some of your ways. (pause; then) One of the books I read was the Bible.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: The whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes. And I read about... heaven.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (grins) Nice place to visit, but I'm not quite ready to move in.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What do you think heaven is like?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) A lot of lying around on clouds, smiling, feeling good... not having to worry about paying the rent, catching cold, going hungry. Kind of like going fishing on a summer day, kicking back, having fun, dreaming about the Cubs winning the world series. A pleasant silence. She stares at him level slowly, he seems to understand. His expression changes to one of total awe. ly. Then, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; quietly) That's what your world is like? Heaven? A pause. Then, looking away, perhaps trying to hide her grief: ; 7 "+t MARY That's what my world was like... before the enemy came. _

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 206
dialogues.text: The magnitude of her loss settles over him like a suffocating fog. He moves beside her, reaches out, gently takes her into his arms, holds her. cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reels continue to spin even though there's only silence now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cigarette is crushed out in the overflowing ashtray. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no lights from any of the rooms now. Only the neon signs continue to glow, and one small light from the motel's office. INT. MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT ° : 210 Mary is still seated on the bed. Joey is standing by the window, peeking through the blinds. He turns toward Mary.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Did you say something? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. Nov. 20/84 f 73A * +> 220s contrnuED: * 210°

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No. e@ Joey's confused.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes. I was only thinking. A pause. Joey's still confused. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: I could've sworn I heard you say something. Mary merely watches him. Joey moves away from the window. Then hesitantly:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: There's something I've been wanting to ask you. (pause; then) Do men and women in your world ...?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He doesn't complete the question, but she understands hin.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Not at all? I mean... never?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: I don't understand. How do you have kids?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: In ways not unlike some of those you're beginning to experiment with on earth. ‘ JOEY You mean, artificially?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Except when something 1s done a certain way for so long, it ° isn't considered artificial, but natural.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: You don't have parents?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We have many parents... and many children. But no one has only one parent, or one child.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: What about love?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes... we love; but not with any greater feeling toward one, than toward another. Joey turns away and lies back on his pillow.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: It's hard to figure. A silence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: Will you teach me your way? A beat, and then Joey turns back to face her. He searches her eyes, perhaps needing assurance.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm part of your world now. : Help me to feel it. i A final hesitation, and then Joey begins to do as she's i asked... so gently, so purely that it's as if he's experiencing it for the very first time; aware of, and willing to accept, the profound weight of his responsibility. After a moment, but with the sounds of their lovemaking continuing in the b.g., CAMERA SLOWLY DRIFTS away from them and toward the window. There, it PEEKS THROUGH a : crack in the blinds, and then -- as it did once before, ! but from the opposite wing of the motel court -- it 7 RACKS FOCUS to include the darkened window across the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the cover of night, the motel looks even more decrepit.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL DOOR 212
dialogues.text: It cracks open and Joey peers out, checking the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in the fresh clothes Stewy brought, he turns to Mary -- who's still in bed, under the covers, looking very much at peace with her new world.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: I'll be back in ten minutes. Don't go out, and don't open the door for anyone -- not even Stewy or Ralph, okay? She nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOEY \
dialogues.text: (continuing) ; | Promise me. |

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes. I promise. He lingers for a moment, staring at her. Then, quickly crossing back to the bed, he leans down and kisses her. She responds, eagerly. He reluctantly pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (grins) Talk about a fast learner... She smiles. He crosses back to the door, peeks out again, then sets the latch, steps out, closes the door behind him. We HEAR the bolt close. EXT. MOTEL - DAY 2i4 Joey walks, then jogs around to the back of the motel -- glancing more than once over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see where Joey parked the Professor's car, half- hidden between a pair of garages. He unlocks it, gets in, drives off. CAMERA TILTS UP to include a helicopter, so high above that its engines can't be heard, and barely more than a brief gleam in the sky. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is standing in front of the sink and mirrored * medicine cabinet. From the angle we're shooting we * can't get a direct look at her face. We know, however, * that she's applying makeup, because lots of it is . scattered all over the sink top. ial

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Still a teasing shot, we can't quite see what she's - doing.  sn 218

dialogues.speaker: 218-B
dialogues.text: Rev: Nov. 8/84 77.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: It voilently burst open as two men leap into the room and two others cram the doorway, each armed withan Uzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whirls around, and for the first time we see her face. She's created a mask of makeup which is at once charming and - surely through the eyes of the Feds - frightening.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: One of the agents shows his identification.

dialogues.speaker: MAN -
dialogues.text: Federal Agents, Miss. Please don't try to resist. Mary stares at the four very nervous-looking men, and the four seapons aimed at her. She looks like a young girl who's been playing with her Mother's makeup. Either that, or someone from another planet. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, returning, passes it by -- checking the area, always on guard. He turns the car Anto the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey parks the car where it was earlier, hops out with a restaurant-bag of breakfast food. He heads toward the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuing to survey the area, he approaches the door, fishing for his key. He unlocks the door and steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems to sense her absence even before he can confirm it. The room is empty; the bathroom door partially ajar.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Mary? He tosses the bag onto the bed, runs across the room and shoves open the bathroom door. Finding the room empty, he whirls around.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; a crazed shout) Mary?

dialogues.speaker: EXT, MOTEL
dialogues.text: He runs from the room and out into the parking area.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Mary?! Mary?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open as Joey bursts in, wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: PAVOR MANAGER 225
dialogues.text: He's a tough-looking man in his forties, unshaven, wearing soiled pants and a sleeveless T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; in a@ rage) Where's the girl?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girl?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: I came in here last night with @ girl! I left her in the room ten minutes ago and now she's gone! Who took her?!

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Sorry, pal. Didn't see a thing. Joey almost launches himself across the counter, grabs the man by the shoulders in a vice-like grip.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: If you're lying to me, I'll kill you! The two men glare at each other. Then, without giving an inch to fear, the Manager reaches up and yanks Joey's hands free.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: What I said was: I didn't see a@ thing. A brief, dangerous silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey runs back out of the office and into the center of the U-shaped court.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (bellowing) Mary?! Mary?! He's like a wild animal that's lost its mate; like a lion that's lost its cub. We feel his wrenching pain; and even more, his deadly anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and Ralph are alone, sitting on some rocks, the two of them staring out across the lake, the city looming behind them. The atmosphere is desolate. For a@ moment, just the distant shriek of birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: | . : . Suppose I believe you... what then?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: . (shakes his head) Cc I don't know.
: We could go to the cops; tell ‘them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd lock us both away. Me | for murder; you for believing | me,

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Then what do we do, huh? Sit around skipping stones across the lake? (viciously quiet) Where the hell is Stewy, man?! Who's got him? What're they doing to him?

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY
dialogues.text: A pause, and then he turns -- suddenly -~ and rivets his gaze at Ralph... or through Ralph.  233 234 235 236

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR RALPH
dialogues.text: Uneasy, almost scared.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's wrong with you? What're you looking at me like that for?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He turns away from Ralph, but his stare actually intensifies.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Watching Joey, he feels a chill. He shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Joey stands up. Ralph doesn't take his eyes off him. RALPH . (continuing) Joey? You okay, man? Joey turns to him. The tension in his face seems to drain away. His normal focus returns. He looks at Ralph, actually seeing him now.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: She's in the Federal Building.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: It was the Feds who got her. And now they're holding her there.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (wary) How d'you know that? Joey stares at him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: I know. It's in his voice, in his manner. Ralph senses it: Joey does know. 82. 233 234 235 236

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) There's a room... not an office but a room, big room. There's elght, ten, maybe twelve people in there -- all of them staring at her, jabbering at her.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What's she telling them?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (pause; he shakes his head) Nothing. (grins, proud of her) She's not giving an inch.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: What about Stewy? Can you see - Stewy? Joey pauses, trying to perceive the answer. Then, brightening:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's in there somewhere. too. And he's okay. He's okay. He looks back at Ralph. Ralph looks away, feeling uneasy. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) She's in there, Ralph. I'll bet my life on it. They both are. Sixth floor.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, your life's not going to be worth two cents, you try and bust in there. It'd be easier getting into Fort Knox. Then, quietly, but grimly, intent:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: She's talking to me, Ralph. She doesn't have to be here, she doesn't have to speak... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JOEY (cont'd) She doesn't even have to open her mouth. But I can hear her. I can hear her in my head, just as plain as day. A beat, and then Joey suddenly turns and begins walking away.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: Hey! Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 238
dialogues.text: Joey keeps walking, doesn't even @lance back. His look of determination is almost ferocious.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Going to get her, Ralph. I'm going to spring her.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: (shouting now) You're crazy, man! You can't just go waltzing into the Federal Building!

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (half under his breath) Let 'em try and stop me. He keeps walking. Ralph looks frustrated to the point of tears,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An institutional-gray facade. Joey walks in. CAMERA PANS to include the gray Mercedes with the tinted windows as it pulls to the curb, a quarter of a block away. A beat, and then the doors open and the two Nazis step out. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People move in and out. One security guard mans the information desk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Two other guards monitor a railed passage through which all visitors must pass to gain access to the building's elevators. It's immediately evident that no one is admitted without an identity card or pass. FAVOR JOEY o 24. He stalls, standing alongside the large office directory, his tension very apparent as he watches the routine, the display of passes, the guarded admissions.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY 242
dialogues.text: He moves away from the office directory and begins toward the guards, walking casually, slowly, not really clear as to what he'll say or try to do. But now, a sudden break: ANGLE - SCENE 243° An alarm BELL goes off, a harsh, clanging sound that immediately gathers everyone's attention. Then, from one of the two-way radios the guards wear in holsters around their waits, a garbled communication. FAVOR JOEY 2aky He stops dead in his tracks. Is 1t him? Have they already spotted him? He looks around, scared half to death.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS 245
dialogues.text: One of them shouts to the security man at the information counter:

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Take it over! Now! He indicates their station, and now both guards immediately turn and race off toward the fire stairs, abandoning their post.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 246
dialogues.text: He turns to look toward the security guard. He's an older man, a slow-moving fellow, who must extricate himself from behind his counter. It'll take a few seconds, precious seconds, during which the main post will be vulnerable.  248 249

dialogues.text: ~ “wap image Gneniie ater oye . Joey keeps Beara He oboe ‘the railing d almost flies toward the elevator. The elevator operator closes the door in Joey's face. Joey watches in

dialogues.text: ANGLE - SECURITY GUARD  - a * He tugs at his gun. ANGLE = JOEY ut : oe He runs for the stairs and charges up. NEW ANGLE.- Joey ; * He takes the stairs two and three at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ce I'm coming to get you, Mary. . Just hang on. INT. FEDERAL BUILDING, 3rd FLOOR HALL - DAY * Joey appears at the top of the stairs. A number of employees pass here and there. Getting his ragged breathing under control, Joey begins down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes flit from one side of the hall to the other. An endless number of doors; the sameness almost stupifying.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (muttered) Where are you, Mary? Tell me where you are?

A grim-faced man in civil servant's suit steps out, glaring briefly at Joey as if he was his worst enemy. But now: ; :

dialogues.speaker: STEWY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (a shout) Joey! Joey looks past the man and into the. room he's come from - ANGLE - STEWY ae 355 He leaps from a chair and tries to run toward the open door, but two other men, federal agents, grab him and hold him back. : :

dialogues.speaker: STEWY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Get outta here, man! Are you crazy?! Get the hell outta here!

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 256
dialogues.text: Joey immediately starts for the open door, but the man who was standing there suddenly ducks back into the room and slams the door in his face. Joey pounds on the door. 7 Heke (CONTINUED)

It, too, bursts open, and three more agents step into the hall. Pe 261 FAVOR JOEY Deets 261 ig Trapped. £ = gr - “262 NEW ANGLE - SCENE coe - 262 pie . The agents begin advancing from both ends of the hall. The civilians in the hall step aside, step back, clear the way. Joey runs to the closest door, tries the knob, finds it locked. He races to the next. The agents are Closing in. Joey tries the next door; it, too, is locked. He races back across the hall and throws himself at a third door. This one isn't locked. It opens. Joey leaps in. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey slams the door shut, fumbles with the lock, throws his weight against the door, then turns to face the interior of the room. :

dialogues.speaker: MARY 264
dialogues.text: She sits alone at one end of a mammoth conference table in this stark, cold, windowless room. She looks small, * terribly vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY 265
dialogues.text: His heart goes out to her. But nowhe senses something, senses danger. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: GLASS WALL 266
dialogues.text: The wall is as dark as night -- until it slowly begins to brighten, and finally to reveal what's behind it: which is another room. There are a dozen people in this room, all of them standing behind the glass partition, all of them dressed in bureaucratic clothing, wearing bureaucratic expressions, and staring -- with bureaucratic insincerity -- at Joey.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 267
dialogues.text: He looks away from them and toward Mary, as if for understanding.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR SPOKESMAN 268
dialogues.text: He's the major bureaucrat, 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he speaks, his voice is not heard * directly, but through a speaker mounted on a wall in Joey and Mary's side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming, Joey. We've been waiting for you. Anxiously. (pause; then) I hope they didn't make it too hard for you to get in. He smiles, gently. A brief, stunning silence. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT FIVE
dialogues.text: Cc 269

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing has changed. Everyone is still where they were. Joey isn't liking it at all.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Who're you?

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: A friend.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Why don't I believe you? He turns, unlocks the door, tries to open it. It's securely locked from the hall side. He looks back at the Spokesman and the dozen other bureaucrats, shielded behind the glass wall.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: (he's never threatening) Our colleague, Professor Hobbs, a distinguished scientist and a remarkable woman, is dead. With respect to her memory, and so that she'll not have died in vain, we're asking for your cooperation. Joey turns to Mary, then back to the Spokesman.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (truthfully) I don't have the slightest idea of what you're talking about, man. A pause. The dozen bureaucrats flanking the Spokesman stare at Joey like a silent Greek chorus.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: We've been aware of... Mary... since she arrived on our planet several days ago.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (shocked) What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: It would've been quite easy to have... detained her.._But a decision was made -- a good one, I think -- merely to watch and, of course, to monitor, the young lady's activities.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 270
dialogues.text: It's getting through to him Tow. We see the dawning in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: You've been watching us?

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR SPOKESMAN 271
dialogues.text: If he senses Joey's growing outrage, he doesn't show it. He continues, cool as a cucumber.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: And hoping to continue to do the same. With your cooperation, of course.

dialogues.speaker: PAVOR JOEY 272
dialogues.text: He stares at the man, beginning to hate him.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: The same meaning what?

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: Clinical observation. Joey begins walking toward the glass wall.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) We're not gathered here for our amusement, but in the name of scientific exploration.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 273
dialogues.text: Joey stands at the glass wall, separated from the Spokesman only by the two inches of glass between them. His voice 4s unsteady now, his anger extreme. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Like watching rats in a cage...

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: . That isn't fair.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Running around the hoops and the mazes...

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: I'm confident that you're a bright enough young man to see the...

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: No chancel He didn't say it loudly, but the emphasis was inescapable. There's a dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: If you'll just let us...

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 274
dialogues.text: He explodes, beating at the glass wall with his hands, kicking it with his feet, bellowing at the Spokesman and the others:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: No chance! D'you hear? Not a chance! He continues to bash at the glass wall, but it doesn't give an inch. Now, though, the light in the room beyond the glass begins to fade. The Spokesman and the dozen others -- watching impassively, clinically -- slowly disappear in darkness. Joey continues to shout at them, his voice growing hoarse. And then, finally, he stops -- exhausted, sweating -- and turns to face Mary.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 275
dialogues.text: There are tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. A beat, and then Joey suddenly moves away from the glass, quickly crosses the room, sits down beside her, takes her hands in his.  e-> 93.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (intense, but quiet) No more apologies. Okay? No more. A beat, and then Mary nods. Joey glances over his shoulder at the dark glass wall, then turns back to Mary and moves even closer to her.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; whispering; an almost painful urgency This morning, when I came back to the motel and you were gone, I knew that I'd been waiting for you all my life. And even if I could never keep you, I had to see you again. I had to touch you again. She searches his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why did you say that? About not being able to keep me?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Because I know the future, Mary. Just like you do. She looks down, tears in her eyes again. He holds her hands even more tightly.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing; still whispering) We connected, you and me. I heard you talking to me this afternoon, even though we were miles apart. And I can hear you now... loud and clear. (pause; then) You're going home. She looks up at him through her shimmering eyes. He wipes a tear from her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Do you understand why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (nods) I think so. But I want to hear it from you. Only not now. Not here. He glances over his shoulder again at the glass.- Then, turning back to Mary:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Can you get us out of here?

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR MARY
dialogues.text: A beat. She glances around the room, then back at Joey, and she nods. Joey stares at her. God only knows what she's planning. A drop of perspiration has appeared on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see nothing beyond the darkness, but we can sense the watching eyes. 94. 276 277 278

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING MARY 279
dialogues.text: As we've seen before, the slight hint of strain in her expression,

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR CONVERENCE TABLE 280
dialogues.text: It's five feet wide and twenty feet long. It begins to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 281
dialogues.text: He'd been leaning on it, but now, as if he's been electrically shocked, he jerks away.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, JOEY, TABLE, GLASS WALL 282
dialogues.text: The trembling intensifies and soon becomes a genuine RUMBLING. Joey moves away from it in awe. Mary continues to apply the energy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And now, not too gracefully, the massive table begins to vise off the floor: two inches, five, ten! Mary stands up, but her focus remains on the levitated table. Joey's eyes are darting around the room, from Mary to the glass wall. .

dialogues.speaker: GLASS WALL 283
dialogues.text: It, too, has started to tremble. And now, as the commotion intensifies, the huge piece of glass begins to crack, and the SOUND of it is like gunshots. NEW ANGLE - SCENE ‘ 284 The glass doesn't break apart, but shatters nontheless. The table, however, literally flies across the room, slams into the opposite wall, and explodes through it -- creating a gaping hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several people in this office, all of them now Pale and trembling in their seats as they stare at the massive table protruding through the wide hole in their office wall. And now, as if that wasn't enough, Joey and Mary suddenly leap through the opening and into their office, don't even bother to glance their way, run for the office door, open it, and leap out into the hallway. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open and four agents burst in, each armed with an automatic rifle. They immediately begin to run toward the shattered wall.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: No! The agents stop, turn.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: The lights come on behind the shattered glass wall and we see the spokesman, now alone, his face distorted through the shades of glass.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: No shooting. There's to be no shooting. Brief pause.  288 289 290 291 292 293 294 295

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev: Nov. 8/84

dialogues.speaker: INT, FEDERAL BLDG.
dialogues.text: INTERCUTTING between Joey and Mary and the federal agents, all of them racing up the concrete stairs toward the building's roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire door is flung open and Joey and Mary appear, breathless, gasping. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and, runs with her :to-one edge of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They peer over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you can fly..? ,Can you? ; Mary shakes her head, Seo, Joey takes her hand. *

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 7
dialogues.text: They run to another side of the roof and look over. It's a long drop to a lower level of roof.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Can you jump? Mary doesn't look happy. Joey grins with assurance, climbs over the edge. NEW ANGLE - SCENE . bal Joey lowers his body over the side, hesitates, then lets go. He drops twenty feet. ANOTHER ANGLE - SCENE ae Joey's okay. He looks up at Mary. *

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Come on. I'll catch you. *

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: She's frightened. A sound behind her. She looks. *

dialogues.speaker: DOOR 7
dialogues.text: It opens to reveal the Feds. : * 1a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs over the edge and drops. Joey slams the door shut, looks around, grabs Mary's 297 298 299 300 301 302

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run to ‘the edge and look down. ANGLE - JOEY AND act

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Band in hand they race across the roof. and disappear behind a structure...

dialogues.speaker: FEDS
dialogues.text: They're reluctant to make the twenty foot arop bd the lower roof. ANGLE - JOEY, MARY aL * They see a partially open window. Joey crawls in, helps Mary in. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spokesman speaks to someone over the phone.. *

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESMAN
dialogues.text: I want every man who's available ® to us! Every vehicle, every piece ® of equipment. Do I make myself * clear? And I want them now! bal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and Mary race down. : 7 EXT. FED. BUILDING REAR EXIT - DAY bad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open as Joey and Mary leap out. 7

dialogues.text: pele PROHE ON dat a OT MH “i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 307 NEW ANGLE — SCENE — 307 The two of them are racing toward a corner and are a | split-second from rounding it when the Nazis appear. ! Mary cries out. The Nazis are briefly caught off guard. Joey's pace never falters and he plows directly into them, straight-arming the two of them, knocking them both flat onto their backs.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR WEAPON 308
dialogues.text: The gun under one Nazi's belt is dislodged and clatters across the sidewalk. Joey almost dives for it, grabs it, spins around and aims it at the two Nazis.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold it! Joey looks.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR AGENTS 309
dialogues.text: They're twenty-five yards away, poised in firing positions.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR JOEY 310
dialogues.text: Ignoring the Nazis and the agents, he grabs Mary's hand, tugs her toward him, and the two of them race around the corner and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 311
dialogues.text: The agents start running toward the corner. The Nazis leap to their feet and burst away in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR AGENTS 312
dialogues.text: They arrive at the corner in a mass of confusion, look one way, then the other. Joey and Mary have lost themselves in the crowd, as have the Nazis.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: (profoundly frustrated) Damn! FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rev. Nov. 12/84

dialogues.speaker: ACT_SEVEN
dialogues.text: FADE IN: Ht : OMITTED : oe 313

INT. PooL ROOM 7 : 314 It's Friday night and the joint is jumping. Joey and Mary have just entered and are working their way across the crowded flood to the bar. Joey's a popular fellow and everyone seems to know him and greet him warmly. Mary, of course, is a newcomer, and her exotic beauty doesn't go unnoticed. She smiles in her shy way, breaking hearts left and right. 7 Joey calls to FRANKIE, the owner. = 7

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Frankie? Can I use the office? Frankie nods. a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Thanks. How ‘bout your car?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: How ‘bout paying my taxes... while you're at 1t? =o JOEY It's important. So's my paint job. There's a brief standoff, and then Frankie relents, reaches into his pocket, tosses Joey the keys.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: You're a saint. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey and Mary enter, Joey closing and locking the door behind then. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The office is a mad clutter of sports memorabilia: framed glossies, autographed; press clippings, yellowed with age; bats, balls, ancient leather mitts, a rusty catcher's mask, and more. Mary takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (understanding) 7 Frankie's kind of a sports nut. And now he sort of flops down on the cracked naugahide couch, his profound weariness suddenly overtaking him. A moment, and then Mary sits beside him. She takes one of his hands in hers.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: There's very little time left. Joey nods, knowing it. FAVOR MARY 316.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (continuing) When I came here I was afraid. I'd run away from everything and everyone I knew... because I could see no other way. But then I met you, and saw the way you lived your life, and saw how you were ready to fight and even die for what you believed in, and just as ready to fight for me -- who you barely knew. (pause; then I felt ashamed. You have so much courage, Joey. So much dignity. And I've been a coward: running, hiding, pretending I could forget everything I had if I could only get far enough away from it. (another pause; then) What you've shown me, what you've taught me, I now have to find a way to teach the people of world. Because if I don't... if I can't... that world will end... and I'll be as much to blame as our enemy. Joey's making an extraordinary effort to control his emotions. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His heart is being ripped to shreds, but he won't allow himself to succumb to the pain... not now, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Do you know where their ship is?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Can we get there in time?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We have to. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Do we have any time at all? She stares at him, understanding his meaning. She 7 moves back into his arms. They kiss passionately, desperately, as their entwined bodies slowly sink onto the cushions of the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie's car, driven by Joey, speeds down a rural road.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What will happen to you, after I'm gone?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: You mean with the Feds?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Well, I kind of imagine they're just a little upset with me right now. But they ought to cool off... I guess. After a while, anyway. A pause. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to tell you some things, about my world, so that you can tell then.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: What kind of things?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Ways of extending life... of increasing the rate of plant Growth... of developing new forms of energy... of controlling disease... of space travel...

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (awed) You have answers to all that?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes. And soon you will, too.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: But how? There isn't time. I'd never even learn part of it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (patiently) Listen to me: just like we were able to communicate before, without speaking, I'm going to give you as much of my knowledge as Ican. And after I have, it will be the same as if that knowledge has always been within you. It'll be your knowledge, Joey... in exchange for all you've given me. He glances at her, still unsure, very uneasy. She smiles, reassuringly. He looks back through the windshield at the road.

dialogues.speaker: MARY 319
dialogues.text: She settles back in her seat, then closes her eyes. She seems instantly at peace. CAMERA SLOWLY PANS to include Joey, staring straight ahead, as they speed on through the night. But the transfer of intelligence has already begun.  ~e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights pierce the gloom like beacons of wisdom. cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of dark, angular structures, abandoned long ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie's car drives into one of the hulking, empty buildings, slows, then stops. Joey turns off the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey stares straight ahead through the windsheild, - confused, even awed by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Is that ... the ship?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (nods) Yes. A beat, and then Joey exits the car - Mary does the same.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOURING JOEY
dialogues.text: He stares at the outer space ship. Clearly, it must be something unlike anything he might have expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty yards away, it hovers motionlessly about eighteen inches off the floor, backlit by moonlight streaming in through a row of enormous windows. It's a gloriously simple creation, barely more than ten feet high and five feet wide, a pair of triangular- shaped glowing glass tubes connected at the base by a third tube, this one an oval. It looks like a piece of kinetic sculpture, shimmering with it's neon- like gasses in ice-cream colours.  e>» KeV. NOV. 8/84

dialogues.speaker: FAVOUR JOEY
dialogues.text: He remains in quiet awe of this object.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (almost whispered) I don't understand. You travel in that? :

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: But it's ... nothing. It's open. It doesn't have any walls, any seats, any engines, any controls ...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No. But we do travel in it ... like light. He stares at her, still very unsure.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: It's one of your ships?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yes. Their's are very primitive. They couldn't have come this far in one of their own. (pause; then) They have very little compared to us. Which is why they wanted our world ... and took it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A silence. Joey searches the surrounding darkness.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Do you think they're here? She looks at him. Then, almost as if it's a test:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Do you? A beat. He looks around again, this time letting himself "sense" the area, as well as see it. Then, nodding:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I don't think they're together. A silence, as they both try to pin down the enemy's location. Then, taking her by the arms, he gently turns her toward him.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) We don't have the time to play cat and mouse with them. I've got to smoke them out... draw 7 their fire. |

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No,

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: There's no other way. How long will it take you to get off the Ground, once you're inside?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It's almost immediate.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Alright. Then you're going to have to be ready to make a run for 1t. Okay? She doesn't speak. He pulls her against him. She wraps her arms around hin, fiercely. Then, grinning through his own tears; .

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Will you write? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Reve Of OF 107. ha 326

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we live, we'll always be together. She lifts her face to his and kisses him, and this time it's as if they'll never part. But then, when they do:

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Will you come back? Ever? MaRY * How long will you wait for me?

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: As long as there's hope.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Then hope. Always hope. They kiss again, even more 4ntensely. And then, in the most selfless act he's ever made, Joey breaks away from her and runs.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: He's like a dark streak, racing across the emptiness, having no idea when -- or even 4f -- an attack will be launched.

dialogues.speaker: NAZI . 328
dialogues.text: He steps out from the cover of his hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Joey!!!

dialogues.speaker: JOEY 7 330
dialogues.text: He doesn't take the time to look, just hits the Floor * and rolls like a tumbler. The night brightens with the explosion from the Nazi's gun. The wall twenty feet * in front of Joey erupts like a volcano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues his roll and comes up on one Imee, aims and fires.

dialogues.speaker: NAZI
dialogues.text: A direct hit. The Nazi, along with whatever he was standing near, is pulverized in a flaming, thundering explosion.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He drops back down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Now, Mary! Run! Run!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: She races from the safety of her hiding place, running directly for the ship.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He scans the area, desperately looking for a clue to the other Nazi's position. ANGLE — SHIP * 336 The second Nazi is suddenly there, directly in front of i

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: She stops abruptly, staring in horror.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Joey!!!

dialogues.speaker: JOEY 7 338
dialogues.text: He whirls around, prepared to fire.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 7 339
dialogues.text: The Nazi stands 2fi front of the ship, . Joey's weapon aimed directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (an anguished, frustrated cry) I can't shoot! If he goes, so will the whole ship!  ee 340 341 342 343. 344 345 Rev. NOV. &/84 109. CLOSE - NAZI Poe 340 For an instant, he almost seems to smile. But it's a chilling expression, more like the rictus grin ofa corpse. And then he slowly raises his hand, and in it, another weapon, aimed not at Mary, but Joey.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Nott!

dialogues.speaker: NA2I
dialogues.text: as, doubtlessly for the first time in her life, Mary uses her power to destroy a living creature, and the Nazi seems to blow apart from the inside out. ANGLE - JOEY hal 343 He's momentarily staggered by the sight.

dialogues.speaker: MARY . . 344
dialogues.text: She turns her head away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey runs to her, takes her into his arms, holds her. She looks at the ruin around them.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Is this the price of freedom? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Nobody can answer that but you, (pause; then) But you better figure it out before you get home. She looks up at him, her face shimmering with tears, then reaches out and touches his cheek as she did once before -- as he taught her. In the b.g., the distant THUD of helicopter rotors. She breaks away and runs to the ship,and steps into it where she, too, seems to hover eighteen inches above the warehouse floor, surround by the delicate tubes of coloured light.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY 7
dialogues.text: We can see the pain in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: A beat, and then she slowly disappears.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: We see his lips form her name, but no sound comes out.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOUR
dialogues.text: It's immersed in new light, laser-like beams, radiant, almost blinding. And now the entire shape begins to rise off the floor, the light moving with it.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY ,
dialogues.text: There are tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light hovers over the floor, floats gaily, turns, then suddenly accelerates. CLOSE - JOEY bad He's terrified. ANGLE - SHIP bal It speeds toward the massive windows and smashes directly into them.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: (A horrified shout) Mary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fantastic explosion as millions of bits of glass fly outward into the night, all of them tinted by the colours of the glowing ship.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He races across the warehouse to the destroyed window and stares out.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: “He searches the sky. For a beat, there's nothing. But now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light reappears, shimmering brilliantly, a kaliedescope rainbow of colours against the black sky. : 359 CLOSE ~- JOEY bal 359 He stares up at the light until it's gone from sight. In the b.g., the roar and thud of the helicopter. Joey looks.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER 7 360
dialogues.text: It hovers a couple of hundred feet off the ground, it's searchlight playing down over the warehouses.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He steps back from the windows, then turns to look at Frankie's car, forty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: It hulks there, motionless.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: A bead of perspiration appears on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: More sweat.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Concentrating intensely, trying not to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picking up speed, coasting nicely

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: A grin begins to turn up the corners of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CAR 7 370
dialogues.text: The headlights flash on, almost merrily.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY _
dialogues.text: He stands there illuminated by the headlights as the car rolls to a polite stop in front of him. In the b.g., the thundering roar of the helicopter as it sets down outside the shattered windows and it's spinning rotors make the dust inside the structure swirl around Joey and in front of the headlights, twinkling and shimmering like a tiny but active universe.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: A massive steel door slides open behind Joey and a dozen federal agents slowly step into the warehouse, each man armed with an automatic rifle, all of them silhouetted by the light behind them. FAVOUR - Joey * 373 He doesn't even seem to notice them as they slowly fan out in a wide semi-circle and begin their cautious approach. Instead, his gaze is locked on the moon and stars beyond the shattered window. And - in his mind, at least - A single pinpoint of light fading into infinity.
